column1: Come on, come on. She's been under too long.
The name, pal. Give us the name.
Would you like to watch a movie, Mr. Rosen?
Would you like to watch a movie, Mr. Phelps?
Would you consider the cinema of the Ukraine?
Perhaps you'll choose one for me.
The man you're looking at is Alexander Golitsyn...
an attach√© at our embassy in Prague.
He has stolen one half of a CIA NOC list...
a record of all our deep-cover agents working in Eastern Europe.
For security reasons, the NOC list is divided in two.
The portion that Golitsyn already has contains code names...
but this half is useless without its mate...
which matches the code names with their true names.
It is this half which Golitsyn plans to steal from the embassy...
shadow Golitsyn to his buyer, and apprehend them both.
I've already dispatched a team, selected from your usual group.
Jack Harmon can hack into any security system.
and Ethan Hunt will be your point man, as usual.
He is now in Kiev and will rendezvous in Prague...
at a safe house of your choosing.
As always, should you or any member of your IM Force...
the Secretary will disavow all knowledge of your actions.
This tape will self-destruct in five seconds.
We photograph Golitsyn stealing the NOC list...
Ethan, you're going into the embassy in character, during a party...
hide in plain sight, highest possible profile.
Sarah, you're at the party already...
as the embassy's Washington visitor liaison.
Make contact with Ethan. You'll run the game together.
I haven't a thing to wear.
You'll mark Golitsyn, hand him off to Hannah.
Hannah, you'll have him for the duration of the interior.
Fingerprint security, there's access through the elevator shaft here.
So I guess I'm not wearing my tux.
Claire, you're cover outside in the vehicle.
Hannah will join you as Golitsyn goes exterior...
- you two stay on him from there. - Okay.
Anything goes wrong, I call abort.
Regroup here at 4:00 a. m. That's 0400.
Can we get a cappuccino machine in here?
'Cause I don't know what you call this.
'Cause I don't know what you call this.
'Cause I don't know what you call this.
I call it cruel and unusual.
Is it possible it's even worse than that sludge you made...
- in that barn in Kiev? - Thank you.
Take it easy on my wife's coffee, will you?
- We missed you in Kiev, Jim. - Missed you, too, Ethan.
Were you off on one of your cushy recruiting assignments again?
Where'd they put you up this time? The Plaza?
- Now he's getting soft in his old age. - Yeah, he is. Look at him.
If that list gets out into the open...
will be up for grabs to the highest bidders.
Third world terrorists, arms dealers, drug lords...
any and everybody who'd love to get rid of long-term coverts like us.
If they're exposed, they'll be executed.
So I'll run the whole show from the crow's nest here.
Everyone knows their roles. Let's punch out the details.
There's a camera built right into the bridge.
Whatever you see, it sees, and then it transmits it back here.
- Of course I can hear you. - No, in your...
- Can you hear me now? - Loud and clear.
If he has a car waiting, and he rolls...
you stay with him no matter what.
drive the streets around this little quarter.
What do you think I've been doing all morning?
- We're using Waltzer? - He's our guy.
Isn't he chairing the armed services hearing?
Not this week. This week, he's fly-fishing...
at the Oughterard Slough in County Kildare...
- with one of our best Irish guides. - Yep.
And he won't be back anytime soon.
it sounds as if you want to lead the kind of charge...
that Senator Frank Church led in the 1970s...
and in the process destroy the intelligence capability...
I want to know who these people are...
and how they're spending our taxpayers' money.
We were living in a democracy the last time I checked.
You come up against a lock you can't pick, you mash them together...
hasta lasagna, don't get any on ya.
I'm Rand Housman, the ambassador's aide.
- Hello, Mr. Housman. - How was the opera?
Let me see if I can steer you through this reception line.
- How do you do, Senator? - His wife, Mrs. Reid.
- Petr Brandl, the mayor of Prague. - How do you do, sir?
I bet you don't remember me, do you?
Why, of course I do. How are you, Miss Norman?
He's in pocket, on the stairway.
Mr. Golitsyn, nice to see you.
Sarah, mark the package and go to tunnel.
Your advance team mentioned that you'd like a tour of the facilities...
so I've gone ahead and set one up. Excuse me.
which is the only limited-access area in the whole facility.
- Excuse me. Can I help you? - I'm sorry.
As you can see, there's a Marine guard and video surveillance...
and this place is like... Excuse me. I'm sorry.
I know it's in here somewhere.
Now, Sergeant, why are you not in your uniform this evening?
We've been ordered to wear civilian clothes this evening, sir.
Tell me, Senator, do you not have someone on your staff named Jack?
Jack? Well, I think we did have a Jack.
An unreliable fellow, as I recall, constantly late...
We were forced to tie him behind one of my best stallions...
my barn for a few days.
Relax your crap, Foghorn. I'm working on it.
- Thank you. - Have a nice evening.
He's heading to the denied area.
What about my coat? I'm going to freeze.
He's in the box, Ethan. He's in the box.
PHELPS shoots CLAIRE. Struggle between PHELPS and ETHAN. The gun is lost. PHELPS beats ETHAN to the ground. His watch alarm beeps rapidly. He turns, goes up the stairs and...
We're taking Golitsyn's exit. Open these doors.
I'm opening the doors. Go under.
- Saved your ass again, Jack. - Give me a break, pops.
- Transport in five minutes. - Yes, indeed.
Jack, we're in position. Open the doors and let the package roll.
PHELPS shoots CLAIRE. Struggle between PHELPS and ETHAN. The gun is lost. PHELPS beats ETHAN to the ground. His watch alarm beeps rapidly. He turns, goes up the stairs and...
- Jack, what are you doing? - I'm not doing anything.
- Then I got a problem. - Cut the power.
- Cut the power, Jack. - Come on, Jack.
The package is out in the open.
Jim, the package is in the open.
- I've got a shadow. - Can you lose him?
We're being ambushed, Ethan. Abort. That's an order.
Negative. Golitsyn is on the move.
No, damn it! No! I said abort!
Sarah, eye on the package. Jim, I'm coming to you.
Jim gave an abort. We should walk away.
No. We are going to recover that disk. You understand me?
This is Ethan Hunt. They're dead.
- My team. My team is dead! - Jesus.
They knew we were coming, man.
They knew we were coming, and the disk is gone.
The disk is gone, did you... Do you read me? The list is in the open!
Let's just bring you in safely and then we'll worry about that, okay?
- I don't think so. I don't think so. - Don't think. Be sure.
Okay. Location green, one hour. I'll be there myself.
I can't tell you how sorry I am.
I know how much Jim, in particular, meant to you, Ethan...
Here's a passport, visa. Usual drill.
We'll work the exfiltration through Canada, debrief you at Langley.
Throw the Prague police a bone or two.
You know, toss them a few suspects.
I think we've lost enough agents for one night.
You mean, I've lost enough agents for one night.
You seem hell-bent on blaming yourself, Ethan.
Of IMF agents at the embassy tonight.
the waiter standing behind Hannah at the top of the stairs.
Well, for a little over two years...
we've been spotting serious blowback in IMF operations.
The other day, we decoded a message on the internet...
from a Czech we know as Max.
Max, it seems, has two unique gifts...
a capacity for anonymity and for corrupting susceptible agents.
This time, he'd gotten to someone on the inside.
He'd gotten himself in a position to buy our NOC list.
An operation he referred to as job 314...
the job he thought Golitsyn was doing tonight.
But the list Golitsyn stole was a decoy.
That's correct. The actual list is secure at Langley.
Golitsyn was a lightning rod. He was one of ours.
This whole operation was a mole hunt.
This whole operation was a mole hunt.
I want to show you something, Ethan.
your family's farm has been in receivership...
and now, suddenly, they're flush with over 120 grand in the bank.
was supposed to have wiped out that bank account.
Dying slowly in America, after all...
can be a very expensive proposition.
why don't we quietly get out of here and onto a plane?
I can understand you're very upset.
Kittridge, you've never seen me very upset.
All right, Hunt. Enough is enough.
You have bribed, cajoled, and killed...
and you have done it using loyalties on the inside.
You want to shake hands with the devil, that's fine with me.
I just want to make sure that you do it in hell.
Money, money. Where's the damn money?
The other day, we decoded a message on the internet...
from a Czech we know as Max.
He'd gotten himself in a position to buy our NOC list.
I needed you, Ethan. I needed you on the bridge...
Ethan, it's okay. Just calm down.
- It's okay. - You were in the car.
Shut up, I saw you. You were in the car.
No, I got out of the car.
I ran to the bridge. He said someone was just...
Don't give me that. I was on the bridge.
- There was nobody on the bridge. - What happened to Jim?
- Who sent you for me? - Jim's dead?
- Who sent you for me? - Jim's dead?
I walked away. He said abort. I just walked away.
That was four hours ago. Who sent you?
- Did they send you for me? - Who's "they"?
Look, who sent you? Who sent you?
No one sent me. No one sent me.
We were supposed to be back here at 4:00.
4:00 if we abort. We don't return here until 4:00, 0400...
They actually think I killed Jim and everyone else.
Somehow $100,000 finds its way into my parent's bank account.
Kittridge assumes I'm the mole they've been tracing...
and I've been in the employ of an arms dealer, Max...
to get him our NOC list.
I'm gonna get it for him.
Ethan, you're not making any sense.
I think goes by the name of Job.
I can't find him, but if he knows I have the NOC list...
I'm gonna go in and I'm gonna talk to Kittridge myself.
And I'm gonna tell him you had nothing to do with this.
he's gonna assume you're with me.
That's right, and I'm gonna answer it.
Can I trouble you for a match?
Would you remove your hat, please?
- Why? - You wish to meet Max?
- I thought I was going to see Max. - You misunderstood.
Then what the hell am I doing here?
Allowing Max to see you and hear what you've got to say.
Well, I don't communicate very well through a shroud.
Well, if Max doesn't like what you have to say...
you'll be wearing that shroud indefinitely.
I'm willing to take the chance.
Who are you and what are you doing here?
if you simply showed up, I might give it to you?
The penny drops. You are not Job.
Job is not given to quoting scripture in his communications.
Then there was its tone, aggressive but playful.
So you are something of a paradox.
No, no. That's quite out of the question.
The disk Job sold you, it's worthless.
It's bait, part of an internal mole hunt.
And how might you know that?
That is the question I want to ask Job.
I don't know Job any more than Job knows me.
I'm sure you could arrange an introduction.
Because I can deliver the actual NOC list.
The one you have is not only worthless...
it's certain to be equipped with a homing device...
In anywhere from 30 seconds to 10 minutes...
you'll have Virginia farm boys hopping around you like jackrabbits.
It's easy to say the disk is worthless...
when you say I can't look at the information...
and see if it's worthless. Not a tenable position, sir.
Not so good for you, my friend.
I'd say you've got about two minutes.
He's under until he decides to surface.
- We can cut off his transportation... - What can we do, Barnes?
Put a guy at the airport?
How many identities do you think Hunt has?
These guys are trained to be ghosts.
We taught them to do it, for Christ's sake.
Sorry I doubted you, dear boy. You are a good sport.
I don't have to tell you...
My deal with Job was subject to a successful boot scan.
Obviously it didn't pass muster. Deal's off.
What was your deal with Job?
I'll give you the same, but I want the complete list now...
I won't do this piecemeal. It's too dangerous.
- I want the entire list. - $10 million.
$10 million in negotiable US Treasury certificates...
Your personal assurance that Job will be at the exchange.
Max made a deal with you?
I deliver the NOC list, Max delivers Job.
We've got 75 rounds for your Beretta but only 20 for the SIG Sauer.
One pair of Visco glasses with monitor...
If I'm not dead, I'm with you.
I want to get the son of a bitch who did this.
We don't have a lot of time, so they're gonna have to be local.
If we're going to Virginia, why don't we drop by Fort Knox?
I can fly a helicopter right in through the lobby...
and set it down inside the vault...
and it would be a hell of a lot easier than breaking into the goddamn CIA.
This doesn't sound like the Luther Stickell I heard of.
The only man alive who actually hacked NATO Ghost Com.
You don't know what you're missing.
- This is the Mount Everest of hacks. - Y'all are kidding yourselves.
Even with top of the line crypto, Cray access, STU-III...
What the hell do you mean, "a little time"?
What the hell do you mean, "a little time"?
That's not what Claire tells me about you.
I'm talking about the 686 prototypes with the artificial intelligence risk chip.
And I get to keep the equipment when we're done.
Luther, I guess you're all out of excuses.
Look, I just can't hack my way inside.
See, there's no modem access to the mainframe.
It's in what we call the stand-alone...
which means I'd have to be physically at the terminal.
It's much worse than you think.
The terminal is in a black vault lockdown.
The only person allowed in the room...
has to pass through a series of security checks.
The first is a voiceprint identification and a six-digit access code.
This only gets him into the outer room.
Next, he has to pass a retinal scan.
are only deactivated by a double-electronic keycard...
whenever the technician is out of the room.
The first is sound-sensitive. Anything above a whisper sets it off.
The second system detects any increase in temperature.
Even the body heat of an unauthorized person in the room...
will trigger it if the temperature rises just a single degree.
Now, that temperature is controlled by the air conditioning...
coming in through an overhead duct, 30 feet above the floor.
That vent is guarded by a laser net.
The third system is on the floor, and is pressure-sensitive.
The slightest increase in weight will trigger the alarm.
And any one of these systems, if set off...
And any one of these systems, if set off...
Now, believe me when I tell you, gentlemen...
And you really think we can do this?
We picked up alarms in Sector 3, 7, and 12.
Yeah, that's what I've got, too. What sector's the air conditioning?
21, but there's no alarm in Sector 21.
21, but there's no alarm in Sector 21.
No, I gotta get in there and shut it down.
I'm sorry, but nobody gets into any sector...
I'm sorry, but nobody gets into any sector...
where an alarm hasn't gone off.
You wanna blow the fire through this whole building?
Look, no one goes into any sector where the alarm hasn't gone off...
- and it hasn't gone off in 21. - Wait.
- Can I get you anything? - No, thank you.
Too shortsighted. This guy initiates. He's proactive.
The question is, what does he want? Where does he need to get it?
And Barnes, what the hell's that noise?
Hey, there were three of you. Where's the other guy?
Everest, man. You ready to plant the flag?
Krieger, from here on in, absolute silence.
You and I know about this. That's where it stops, you understand?
I want him manning a radar tower in Alaska by the end of the day.
You're not going to any meeting without me.
I don't think you're in any position to give orders. Do you?
Oh, what's the matter? You, you've never seen this trick?
I know what you're thinking, Krieger.
You're thinking, "Back in the computer room...
"I was up here, he was down there.
It's so hard to keep track of these things.
Do you actually think I'd let you have the NOC list?
Try any sleight of hand with my money, I'll cut your throat.
You're off on one of your cushy recruiting assignments again?
Yeah, where'd they put you up this time, The Plaza?
We did what we had to do.
I'm going to try and get some sleep.
Krieger did have the NOC list?
Now I want you to hold on to it.
Because if you knew what you were getting into...
you never would have done it.
I'm not going to let this get out in the open.
Exactly. That's your job tomorrow, on the train.
Don't let this NOC list get out in the open.
What is the range of this thing?
It's hard to tell. I'm gonna have to be close.
Ethan, I need to talk to you.
where federal agents claim to have found...
The operation was masterminded by Margaret Ethan Hunt...
They were arrested this morning by drug enforcement officers...
designed to expose the illegal manufacture...
of the drug methcathinone, known as khat.
I'm afraid what we have here is a case of a naive and lonely widower...
I see you've been out visiting the folks.
It's Hunt. What do you need for a pinpoint?
You've been watching a little TV, have you?
Hauling Mom off to jail in shackles was an especially nice touch.
that my first order of business after you come in...
is to have these ridiculous charges against your family dropped...
and eliminated completely from their files.
Look, if you come in now...
we can plea down the charges against you, as well.
Can I ask you something, Kittridge?
five members of his own IMF team...
how devastated do you think you're gonna make him...
by marching Ma and Uncle Donald down to the county courthouse?
I don't know, Ethan. Why don't you tell me?
He wanted us to know he was in London.
You're a hard man to catch up with.
Next day I managed to drag myself back to the safe house.
I must have just missed you.
And that's when you picked us up in the States.
But you left before I could get there, and I could check just so many places.
Smaller countries don't computerize customs records.
Once you turned up in England, it was easy.
You knew I liked the rentals at Liverpool Street.
Hey, I showed them to you.
Jim, look, who do you think you're kidding here?
A doctor's gotta look at that. You can't sit up straight.
I just can't sit up straight very well.
I saw who shot me. I saw the mole.
My God, of course. You're right.
He was at the embassy that night.
First, he took out Jack at the elevator.
He shot you on the bridge.
He must have had backup take out Golitsyn and Sarah at the fence.
No. No, he could have done Hannah himself.
When you think about it, Ethan, it was inevitable.
The son of a bitch, how dare he?
You're an obsolete piece of hardware not worth upgrading.
You've got a lousy marriage and 62 grand a year.
We'll go after the no-good son of a bitch big time.
We won't have to. He'll come after us.
What's gonna make him do that?
What he didn't get in Prague. The NOC list.
I'm meeting him tomorrow on the TGV en route to Paris.
If I supposedly deliver the NOC list to Max...
Max has agreed to deliver Job to me.
I'll have Claire and Luther Stickell with me on the train.
Krieger is gonna have helicopter transport waiting in Paris.
I was in a cafe waiting for you, Ethan.
standing in the rain, alive and beautiful...
God knows what she's had to do to forget me...
to keep going, get the job done.
She can't know about me, Ethan.
No one can, not till this is over.
Once we leave the safe house, Jim, you get in there and crash.
- I'll call you from Paris. - You got it.
I sent the message to Max.
- What's this? - Incoming, sir, for you.
X- ray's clean, electronics, and no explosives.
- How long to the London Terminus? - Twenty, twenty-five minutes.
This was not what we discussed.
My apologies, Max. It couldn't be helped.
There's a piece of black cloth under your seat.
Tear it away, you'll find the disk.
I hope this doesn't preclude a meeting in private.
Not as long as you tell me where the money is.
The mere possibility is worth $10 million.
Wouldn't worry about him. When you get the money, he'll find you.
- It's not transmitting. - Try it. Try it again.
Damn it, I've got to get this through before we hit the Chunnel.
I can see that. Did you check the batteries?
Don't you give me that. Run it through from the top.
We don't even know what Max looks like.
Look, we don't need to know.
If he's got that list, he's gonna want to check it.
- Is everything all right, sir? - It's just the battery is gone.
Ethan, Kittridge is on the train.
The money's in the baggage car. I'll meet you there.
No one else has seen you alive.
I'm very sorry to hear you say that, Claire.
Ethan Hunt, darling. You remember him, don't you?
- You knew about Jim? - Of course.
Just exactly when he knew is something of a question.
Before or after I showed up in London?
but after you took the Bible from the Drake Hotel in Chicago.
They stamped it, didn't they? Those damn Gideons.
Ethan, if you knew about Jim, why...
Why the masquerade? Why take the risk?
Well, Claire, you've asked the question.
But he didn't know about you.
Claire was never convinced her charms would work on you.
But I was supremely confident, having tasted the goods.
"Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's wife," Ethan.
Let's just get the money and get out of here.
You know, Claire was wrong about one thing, Jim.
I'm not the only one who's seen you alive.
No, no, don't! It'll crash into us!
Look, we cannot just be sitting around, okay? We need...
I think this is what you're looking for.
My lawyers are going to have a field day with this.
Well, maybe we'll just leave the courts out of this one.
I'm sure we can find something I have that you need.
and collided with a high-speed train on its way from London to Paris.
The pilot was killed, but no one on the train was hurt.
Authorities have attributed the accident to instrument failure.
The apology from the Justice Department, VIP treatment...
you know, the whole nine yards.
Well, my mom was a little confused...
how the DEA could mistake her and Uncle Donald...
for a couple of dope smugglers in the Florida Keys.
Hey, I'm the flavor of the month.
Why don't you come back with me?
I just don't know why I'd be doing it.
So how's it feel to be a solid citizen again?
Well, Luther, if it makes you feel any better...
I'll always think of you that way.
Would you like to watch a movie?
Would you consider the cinema of the Caribbean?
